item.title: upcoming test
item.description:
Bees give life to nature, and we've long wanted to learn the art of beekeeping. Is anyone joining us on this journey, or are you too afraid of stings? :)
But before we start, we'll need to make beehives. So, hammers, nails, saws at the starting line.

item.title: upcoming wind 1 - Visit us on the Hill
item.description:
Visit us, come see for yourself, and spend an afternoon on the Hill with us. Perhaps it will also whisper to you what is needed.

Eckdaten: booking system like max. 4 such meeting points pro year connected with calender

item.guid: events/upcoming wind 1 - Visit us on the Hill.md

item.title: upcoming wind 2 - Help us to clean on the Hill
item.description:
There are paths there, waiting to be sought, found, uncovered, and explored for their beauty, which entails a lot of work. It's the kind that anyone can handle, but it demands a lot of time. We'll gladly lend you the shears, and you can immerse yourself with us into the depths of the Hill.

Eckdaten: booking system, maybe with some funnel to another activity
Anmelde-button
item.guid: events/upcoming wind 2 - Help us to clean on the Hill.md

item.title: upcoming wind 3 - Fotos on the Hill
item.description:
The hill and its surroundings are the perfect insta-location. Join us for a DSLR photo workshop or a classic Flexaret session. Radka is, among other things, a professional photographer, and if there's enough interest, she'd be happy to show you all things photography in the best light.

Eckdaten: booking system 1-2 workshops pro year
Anmelde-button
link to Radka
item.guid: events/upcoming wind 3 - Fotos on the Hill.md

item.title: upcoming wind 4 - Plan with us
item.description:
It's a piece of land insufficiently described and mapped—come map it with us through photos, videos, drone footage, in 3D, and together, perhaps we'll weave a new dream that we'll realize one day. Karel is quite skilled in SketchUp and can demonstrate a few things.

Eckdaten: booking system 1 workshop pro year

link to Karel

item.title: @-mention person
item.description:
<%*
// Get the list of people
const people = app.plugins.plugins.dataview.api.pages('"People"')
.sort(x => x.file.inlinks.length, 'desc')
.file.name
// Pop the suggester
const person = await tp.system.suggester(people.map(x => x.replace(/^\W+/, '')), people)
return person ? [[${person}]] : ''
%>

item.title: New note
item.description:
<%*
// New note template configuration
const templatesFolders = ['Utility/Templates/New note templates']
const openNewNoteInSplit = false // Set this to true if you want the new note to open in a split to the right
/*
Full instructions here: https://share.note.sx/2rskmna5
*/
// -------------------------------------
// Nothing to configure after this point
// -------------------------------------
const templateFiles = []
for (const folder of templatesFolders) {
const files = (await app.vault.adapter.list(folder))?.files || []
files.sort((a, b) => a.localeCompare(b)) // Sort alphabetically
templateFiles.push(...files)
}
if (!templateFiles) return
const templates = templateFiles.map(path => {
const file = app.vault.getAbstractFileByPath(path)
const meta = app.metadataCache.getFileCache(file)?.frontmatter || {}
let title = meta.template_title || ''
// Date/time placeholder replacement
const match = title.match(/MOMENT((.?))/)
if (match) title = title.replace(/(MOMENT(.?))/, moment().format(match[1]))
return {
label: file.basename,
title,
templatePath: file.path,
destinationFolder: meta.template_destination_folder
}
})
/**

Create a new note from a Templater template.
@param {string} templatePath - Full vault path to the template file
@param {string} newNoteName - Title / filename of the new note
@param {string} destinationFolder - Full vault path to the destination folder
@param {boolean} [openNewNote] - Optional: Open the new note after creating it
*/
async function createFromTemplate (templatePath, newNoteName, destinationFolder, openNewNote = false) {
destinationFolder = destinationFolder || tp.file.folder(true)
const newFile = await tp.file.create_new(tp.file.find_tfile(templatePath), newNoteName, openNewNote, app.vault.getAbstractFileByPath(destinationFolder))
// Remove the template properties from the new file
app.fileManager.processFrontMatter(newFile, (frontmatter) => {
delete frontmatter.template_destination_folder
delete frontmatter.template_title
})
return openNewNote ? '' : [[${newNoteName}]]
}
/**

Takes a note filename/title, and replaces any filesystem-unsafe characters
with Unicode characters that look the same
@param {string} title
@returns {string}
*/
function makeFilesystemSafeTitle (title) {
// https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10386344/how-to-get-a-file-in-windows-with-a-colon-in-the-filename
// some replacements: ” ‹ › ⁎ ∕ ⑊ ＼︖ ꞉ ⏐
title = title.replace(/:/g, '꞉')
title = title.replace(///g, '∕')
return title
}
const chosen = await tp.system.suggester(templates.map(x => x.label), templates)
if (!chosen) return ''
let title = (await tp.system.prompt('Name for the new file. Will use the current date/time if no value given.', chosen.title || '')) || moment().format('YYYY-MM-DD HH꞉mm꞉ss')
if (typeof title !== 'string') return '' // Prompt was cancelled
title = makeFilesystemSafeTitle(title)
const addLink = await tp.system.suggester(['Yes', 'No'], [true, false], false, 'Insert link in the current file? (Escape = no)')
const destination = chosen.destinationFolder || tp.file.folder(true)
const result = await createFromTemplate(chosen.templatePath, title, destination, !addLink && !openNewNoteInSplit)
if (openNewNoteInSplit) {
// Open the new file in a pane to the right
const file = app.vault.getAbstractFileByPath(${destination}/${title}.md)
// Create the new leaf
const newLeaf = app.workspace.getLeaf('split')
await newLeaf.openFile(file)
// Set the view to edit mode
const view = newLeaf.getViewState()
view.state.mode = 'source'
newLeaf.setViewState(view)
// Give focus to the new leaf
app.workspace.setActiveLeaf(newLeaf, { focus: true })
// Move the cursor to the end of the new note
app.workspace.activeLeaf.view.editor?.setCursor({ line: 999, ch: 0 })
}
return result
%>

item.title: Tasks menu
item.description:
<%*
const tasks = new tp.user.templater_tasks()
return await tasks.openMenu()
%>

item.title: Little about us
item.description:
!!! Achtung Baustelle - Pozor ve výstavbě - Under construction !!! diese Website wird gerade entworfen


We are a family of dreamers, explorers, and creators. With seven of us in the age of 2,3,5,5,7,38 and 38, there's always an abundance of ideas, projects, and adventures. We believe in working together, sharing our passions, and turning our dreams into reality. From gardening and building to learning new skills and preserving nature, every day is a new opportunity to grow and make memories. Join us on our journey as we discover, create, and cherish the beauty of life together.
Actually its pretty hard to find photo, where we are all together... so maybe this one will need to be enough for now... :D


Beyond our immediate family, we have a few people who, whether they are relatives, friends, coworkers, or just like-minded individuals, we consider part of our family too. Our family circle is always open, and there's always room for those who share our values and dreams to join us.

There are also a few heroes to whom we owe a lot, whether they are still with us or sadly no longer here. And in our own way, we are heroes too.
text
Family members
(Special thanks to:
J. H.
T, H, R, and M. F.
H. D. and E. A.
B. P.
Z. R.
Z., V., K., J. B. and P.P.)

item.title: Dreaming our dreams
item.description:
... yes are dreamers! We are a family of 7 with many many dreams...


We are dreamers with many dreams—perhaps too many—but we're diligently working to turn them into reality through numerous projects. Most are naturally unfinished, but that's the essence. These aren't just daydreams; they're active projects we're completing one by one on the long road toward our unseen dreams. One day, we'll surely achieve them. We believe.


Many paths aren't immediately visible, but once you embark on them, they start to become clearer. You begin to navigate them more adeptly, gaining a better understanding of their purpose and where they lead. Those who journey alongside you will also come to understand this path. Are you the one(s) who wishes to accompany us on this journey?


Stories of Heart and Home on Instagram
Stories of Heart and Home on Pinterest
Stories of Heart and Home on YouTube


Perhaps one day there will be a beautiful orchard, vineyard, market garden, treehouse, apiary, cottage, seminar center, or lookout tower here—we're not sure yet. But we do know we're heading in that direction. And if it's a lookout tower, it'll be right here, where that bench stands now.

item.title: Story of the Hill
item.description:
... it was our secret for so long, but now it's time to share its magic with the world...


When we discovered the hill, it immediately enchanted us. It was like opening the door to the mythical garden of the Beast. Impenetrable thickets with thorns so long and sharp they can easily pierce through work boots. But once you get past this barrier, a completely new, untouched, and beautiful world opens up, revealing glimpses of times gone by. This magical space calls for care, the return of love and beauty. It captures our hearts as a lifelong mission, a legacy for future generations.


The dormant volcano with four peaks. This region has a very long and rich history, shaped partly by humans since the Eneolithic period around 3000 BC. The industrial development of the first half of the 19th century seems straight out of a steampunk tale. Mining for olea. Guess where the second electric tram in the Czech lands used to run? The industrial colony of Johann David Starck. Inspiration for Zdeněk Burian's illustrations in 'Journey to the Prehistoric Times'. Giant searchlight. An abandoned orchard at the edge of the world before the ferry across the Berounka River. Territory of poachers and no one else. And now, us. All this is our hill.


Certainly, it's not taken for granted to rediscover and restore its beauty. Every meter of this land is earned through sweat and unwavering determination, qualities you too can embody and help us in our endeavor. That's why it is what it is and will be a project for many years to come. We've built a base under a part of the hill on one of its adjacent plots, a place to rest, a place to immerse yourself in the unique atmosphere of the area, and a refuge from the hustle of everyday life. Come visit us sometime. Or support our effort by renting our caravan near the river.
Riverside
Hint zwei Bilder nebeneinander

item.title: Upcoming
item.description:
!!! Achtung Baustelle - Pozor ve výstavbě - Under construction !!! diese Website wird gerade entworfen

... as we explore our hill, we gradually untangle and weave back together various threads that are important to us, making it easier for us to categorize them into different elements for our own orientation. Let them be the symbolic red thread in the Stories of our Hill..



...it's like when the wind whispers, as if it tells him something, and suddenly he knows where to go and what needs to be done...
Cards of the upcoming events:


We could really use a shed or some kind of storage space for our tools and maintenance supplies. So, it might be easiest to build one ourselves—perhaps from upcycled wood. We've gotten pretty good at this over time. Want to help us out, learn something new, or maybe teach us a thing or two?

Eckdaten
Anmelde-button

A treehouse has always been our big dream, and dreams are meant to be fulfilled :) Plus, we managed to acquire some old beams from a huge pergola, so we could at least put together a platform. What do you think?

Eckdaten
Anmelde-button

A small tractor would be a huge help, but where to park it when there's no space yet? First, we need to build a small depot.

Eckdaten
Anmelde-button

We love theater, and a small natural stage must definitely be part of the hill.
So, when do we start building? It really just takes only time and effort. :)

Eckdaten
Anmelde-button
